intro: Arrhenatherum elatius f. zapalowiczii, commonly known as the Zapalowiczii variant of the tall meadow grass, is a botanical variant characterized by its distinctive morphological features. It is a perennial grass species native to certain regions of Europe, typically found in moist meadows and along stream banks. The plant exhibits elongated, narrow leaves and produces panicles of small, spikelet-bearing flowers during the summer months. This variant is notable for its ecological adaptability and role in supporting local biodiversity. Its botanical significance lies in its contribution to grassland ecosystems and its use in horticultural and ecological restoration projects.
